member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS
member.summary: TheIP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS structure stores a single unicast IP address in a linked list of IP addresses for a particular adapter.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.Length
member.summary: The length, in bytes, of this structure.

summary.para: A set of flags for this IP address.
The following table shows possible values. These constants are defined in the Iptypes.h header file.

listheader.description: The IP address is legal to appear in DNS.
The IP address is a cluster address and should not be used by most applications.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.Next
member.summary: A pointer to the next IP adapter address structure in the list.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.Address
member.summary: The IP address for this unicast IP address entry. This member can be an IPv6 address or an IPv4 address.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.PrefixOrigin
member.summary: The prefix or network part of IP the address. This member can be one of the values from the enumeration type defined in the Iptypes.h header file.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.SuffixOrigin
member.summary: The suffix or host part of the IP address. This member can be one of the values from the enumeration type defined in the Iptypes.h header file.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.DadState
member.summary: The duplicate address detection (DAD) state. This member can be one of the values from the enumeration type defined in the Iptypes.h header file. Duplicate address detection is available for both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.ValidLifetime
member.summary: The maximum lifetime, in seconds, that the IP address is valid. A value of 0xffffffff is considered to be infinite.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.PreferredLifetime
member.summary: The preferred lifetime, in seconds, that the IP address is valid. A value of 0xffffffff is considered to be infinite.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.LeaseLifetime
member.summary: The lease lifetime, in seconds, that the IP address is valid.

summary.para: The length, in bits, of the prefix or network part of the IP address. For a unicast IPv4 address, any value greater than 32 is an illegal value. For a unicast IPv6 address, any value greater than 128 is an illegal value. A value of 255 is commonly used to represent an illegal value.
summary.div: Note This structure member is only available on Windows Vista and later.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS
member.summary: The IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS structure stores a single unicast IP address in a linked list of IP addresses for a particular adapter.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.Alignment
member.summary: Reserved. Used by the compiler to align the structure.

member.name: IP_ADAPTER_UNICAST_ADDRESS.Length
member.summary: The length, in bytes, of this structure.

summary.para: A set of flags for this IP address.
The following table shows possible values. These constants are defined in the Iptypes.h header file.

listheader.description: The IP address is legal to appear in DNS.
The IP address is a cluster address and should not be used by most applications.

member.summary: A pointer to the next IP adapter address structure in the list.

member.summary: The IP address for this unicast IP address entry. This member can be an IPv6 address or an IPv4 address.

member.summary: The prefix or network part of IP the address. This member can be one of the values from the enumeration type defined in the Iptypes.h header file.

member.summary: The suffix or host part of the IP address. This member can be one of the values from the enumeration type defined in the Iptypes.h header file.
